intro: Erigeron stuessyi, commonly known as the desert fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Erigeron stuessyi is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing nectar for pollinators.
